intro: Neogleasonia wurdackii, commonly known as the Wurdack's neogleasonia, is a member of the Asteraceae family and is native to the southeastern United States. It is a perennial herb characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in sandy or well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or disturbed sites. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
